etymologies: early 19th century. From the name of Gustav Rose, German mineralogist + -lite

definitions: A rare mineral containing arsenic and cobalt, typically occurring as rose-red or pink prismatic crystals.

notes.text: Roselite is an arsenate of calcium, cobalt, and magnesium, Ca₂(Co,Mg)(AsO₄)₂·2H₂O. Crystal system: monoclinic.
